item.description:

This post by Madhav Thaker covers three important topics:

Highly recommend reading!

LangChain v0.1.0 Highlights

‚≠êÔ∏èAgents‚≠êÔ∏è

As part of v0.1.0, we:

üñºÔ∏èAdded documentation on the seven different agent types (and when to use each one)
üîóRewrote agents in LCEL for improved ability to customize

Agent Types: https://python.langchain.com/docs/modules/agents/agent_types/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=08qXj9w-CG4

item.title: üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ @togethercompute Embeddings ‚ÜóÔ∏è Today we‚Äôre excited to announce the new langchain-together Python package, which has connecti...
item.description:
üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ @togethercompute Embeddings ‚ÜóÔ∏è

Today we‚Äôre excited to announce the new langchain-together Python package, which has connections to Together‚Äôs LLM and Embeddings endpoints. This is the easiest way to access the next-gen embedding models their team has been developing. Learn‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745508818442969156


Together AI:‚ÄÇWe are thrilled to announce the Together Embeddings endpoint! üöÄ

Higher quality than OpenAI or Cohere in the MTEB benchmark. ‚úÖ
State of the art M2-Retrieval models with up to 32k context length. ‚úÖ
Up to 4x lower price. ‚úÖ

https://together.ai/blog/embeddings-endpoint-release

Detailsüëá

item.title: LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight ‚≠êÔ∏èRetrieval‚≠êÔ∏è One of the main use cases for LangChain is retrieval. Our v0.1.0 release highlights this with: ‚úÇÔ∏èLarge ...
item.description:
LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight

‚≠êÔ∏èRetrieval‚≠êÔ∏è

One of the main use cases for LangChain is retrieval. Our v0.1.0 release highlights this with:

‚úÇÔ∏èLarge selection of text splitters
üß™Myriad of advanced retrieval techniques
üë™Support for multi-tenancy
üè°Indexing pipeline‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745485078283858057
item.author: LangChain

item.title: ‚úÇÔ∏èSemantic Chunking In case you missed it, @GregKamradt is doing a great series on the "5 Levels of Text Splitting" One of the more interesting idea...
item.description:
‚úÇÔ∏èSemantic Chunking

In case you missed it, @GregKamradt is doing a great series on the "5 Levels of Text Splitting"

One of the more interesting ideas he introduces is "Semantic Chunking", where you use embedding distance to split text into chunks

Now in langchain-experimental!‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745483297365578199
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: I thought this was a really creative new way of splitting text So we added it to `langchain_experimental`ü¶úüß™ Check it out here...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHarrison Chase
I thought this was a really creative new way of splitting text

So we added it to `langchain_experimental`ü¶úüß™

Check it out here: https://python.langchain.com/docs/modules/data_connection/document_transformers/semantic-chunker

And watch @GregKamradt's excellent video below to better understand it!


Greg Kamradt:‚ÄÇ5 Levels Of Text Splitting: Semantic Splitting

Goal: Use embeddings to find chunks in our raw text

Experimental method using embedding distances between sequential sentences to tease out 'breakpoints'

If we find a good breakpoint, make a chunk

Check out the full video on YT
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: ü™µüé≤ Using OpenAI Logprobs üé≤ü™µ Did you know OpenAI can return the generation probability of individual tokens? You can even see...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
ü™µüé≤ Using OpenAI Logprobs üé≤ü™µ

Did you know OpenAI can return the generation probability of individual tokens?

You can even see odds for top alternatives - sort of like how "confident" the LLM is in a response vs. other options!

Bump to @LangChainAI ü¶úüîó JS/TS OpenAI 0.0.11‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745476164825563533
item.author: LangChain

item.title: LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight üß±Output Parsing A big use case of LangChain is connecting it to downstream actions. In order to properly do that, you ne...
item.description:
LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight

üß±Output Parsing

A big use case of LangChain is connecting it to downstream actions. In order to properly do that, you need to structure LLM outputs in specific ways

Output parsing helps accomplish exactly that!

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dbjmhCWPKow
item.author: LangChain

item.title: LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight: üéèStreaming Streaming is an important UX consideration - both of LLM tokens, as well as intermediate steps. All chains a...
item.description:
LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight:

üéèStreaming

Streaming is an important UX consideration - both of LLM tokens, as well as intermediate steps. All chains and agents come with built in streaming, making it easy to convey what is happening to end users

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gr5CGL4_jpY
item.author: LangChain

item.title: üöÄNew LangChain reranker ColBERT via @bclavie's RAGatouille framework
item.description:
üöÄNew LangChain reranker

ColBERT via @bclavie's RAGatouille framework


Harrison Chase:‚ÄÇThis is a great addition - ColBERT as a reranker

Makes it really easy to get some of the benefits from ColBERT but in a way where you don't have to update your indexing pipeline

Seamlessly integrates as a LangChain reranker!

https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/providers/ragatouille
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: This is a great addition - ColBERT as a reranker Makes it really easy to get some of the benefits from ColBERT but in a way where y...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHarrison Chase
This is a great addition - ColBERT as a reranker

Makes it really easy to get some of the benefits from ColBERT but in a way where you don't have to update your indexing pipeline

Seamlessly integrates as a LangChain reranker!

https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/providers/ragatouille


Benjamin Clavi√©:‚ÄÇ"I wish I could use the best retrieval model as a reranker in my RAG pipeline, but I don't have time to redesign it!"

We've all been there and thought that, right?

ü™§RAGatouille now lets you do it effortlessly! Retrieve docs as usual&let ColBERT rerank them in a single line‚¨áÔ∏è
item.author: LangChain

item.title: LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight: üîóComposability A big part of LangChain v0.1.0 is composability. We achieve this by using LangChain Expression Language ...
item.description:
LangChain v0.1.0 Highlight:

üîóComposability

A big part of LangChain v0.1.0 is composability. We achieve this by using LangChain Expression Language - which we've been working on for the past six months

This allows you to compose arbitrary sequences of LLM calls, function‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745149486576644197
item.author: LangChain

item.title: ü¶úLangChain <> DSPyüß© DSPy is a fantastic framework that **compiles** your LLM program Specifically, the DSPy compiler will internally trace your ...
item.description:
ü¶úLangChain <> DSPyüß©

DSPy is a fantastic framework that **compiles** your LLM program

Specifically, the DSPy compiler will internally trace your program and then craft high-quality prompts for large LMs to teach them the steps of your task.

Thanks to @lateinteraction we have‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745138590429163941
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Kpolley: Since this post, I learned about @LangChainAI and turned this POC notebook into a web chat UI interface, GitChat. demo: https://gitchat.kp...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇKpolley
Since this post, I learned about @LangChainAI and turned this POC notebook into a web chat UI interface, GitChat.

demo: https://gitchat.kpolley.com
demo share: https://gitchat.kpolley.com/share/FrAT0ak

The goal is for GitChat to be deployed internally at organizations as a helpful, secure,‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1745138173846385107


Kpolley:‚ÄÇI created a chatbot that can search and understand @runpanther's public threat detection repo. It was wildly easier to do than I expected!

Every DevX team should be exploring how fine-tuned, internally-facing AIs can improve the engineering and operations experience. This is so‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1730314234246865209
